questions.question: The children asked whether they …………………………….. go for a swim. (permission)
questions.description: We use can and could to seek permission.

questions.question: We ………………………….. hear music playing in the next room. (ability)
questions.description: We use can to show ability.

questions.question: If you start now, you ………………………… reach there by midnight. (prediction)
questions.description: We use will to make simple predictions about future.

questions.question: I did all that I ………………………… (ability)
questions.description: A past tense in the main clause is usually followed by a past tense in the subordinate clause. Could is the past tense of can.

questions.question: He said that he ……………………….. lay down his life for his country. (determination)
questions.description: A past tense in the main clause is usually followed by a past tense in the subordinate clause. Would is the past tense of will.

questions.question: Work hard lest you ………………………… fail. (certainty)
questions.description: Should is the only auxiliary that can follow lest.

questions.question: I ………………………. pass. I am not sure. (weak probability)
questions.description: We use might to indicate weak probability.

questions.question: To whom ………………………… I address this letter?
questions.description: We use should to ask for suggestions.

questions.question: She ……………………………. not wait any longer. (lack of necessity)
I don’t know whether I ………………………… have time.
